content: sunrise side bear by noreen slank longlakeyarns net 2018 copyright noreen slank the idea of knitting a flat bear all in one piece was inspired by bear pair teddy bears attributed to unnamed designer a b as published by beverly a qualheim materials 75yds 69m aran or worsted weight models are brown sheep lamb s pride worsted 1-2 yards of dk or fingering weight black yarn for stitching facial features approximately 1 25 ounces of polyester fiberfill stuffing one safety pin or removable stitch marker to mark the bear s belly a length of yarn or stitch holder to hold the stitches needed for the last leg large-eye needle for sewing up needles us 5/ 3 75 mm or size necessary to achieve gauge gauge 12 stitches & 20 row = 2 inches/5 cms in garter stitch unblocked gauge isn t critical but yardage requirements and finished measurements will vary if gauge differs notes sunrise side bear is knit flat on needles 2-3 sizes smaller than typical for the yarn weight this helps assure that the stuffing doesn t show through it s knit in one piece from the back of the legs up over the head down the belly to the front legs stuffed the bear is about 9 inches/23 cms tall and 6 inches/15 cms from arm-to-arm special techniques when casting on for the arms at the start of a row use a knitted cast on method of your choice such as a cable cast on short row form four sections of the bear a simple wrap-and-turn works wraps need to be picked up and knit in with the wrapped stitch to avoid holes once the bear is stuffed abbreviations k knit k2tog knit two stitches together kf&b knit in the front and back of the stitch w&t slip 1 stitch from the left needle to the right needle move the yarn forward put the slipped stitch back on left needle and turn the work to knit back directions backs of legs cast on 8 stitches leave a 24 inch/60 cm yarn tail for sewing up later row 1-22 k cut yarn leave a 24 inch/60 cm yarn tail for sewing up later cast on 8 stitches on the same needle where the first leg dangles leaving a 24 inch/60cm yarn tail row 1-22 k row 23 knit across all 16 stitches to tighten up the legs before knitting the 9th stitch tie a knot that joins the working yarn to the yarn cut at the first leg back row 1-5 k 16 stitches row 6 k14 w&t k12 w&t k11 w&t k10 w&t k9 w&t k8 w&t k7 w&t k6 w&t k5 w&t k4 w&t and knit to the end picking up and knitting in the wraps as they appear on each stitch from the 6th through and including the 2nd stitch counting from the end of the row row 7 k picking up and knitting in the wraps as they appear from the 11th
